messages.title: An election message from Andrew Cooper
messages.content: I am asking for your support to be Huddersfield’s next MP.

I have been elected to the Newsome Ward of Kirklees Council for the last 20 years. I have been elected and re-elected 6 times. During that time I’ve taken up literally hundreds of issues and concerns of local people.

Our Town Centre needs a radical vision for the future. The Huddersfield Blueprint is a good start but we want to act to ensure that locally owned and managed businesses are what prosper here in Huddersfield.
I share the passion of many local people to maintain Accident and Emergency and other vital health services in Huddersfield and I have joined demonstrations and made many representations to that end.

As a Green Party member I want to protect our local trees as well as our global environment. I share the concerns many people have regarding the protection of trees both in our streets and those threatened by development. I want a greater focus on school children in Huddersfield.

I know that many local people are looking for an alternative to our current Labour MP many who are traditional Labour supporters. The traditional Westminster parties have failed us. Voting for me as our MP means you will have a representative who doesn’t write to someone who has a proven commitment to Huddersfield and who will help to make it a better place. It would have a brighter future for Huddersfield.

As a Green Party MP, unlike Labour, Conservative or Lib Dems, I wouldn’t have Party bosses telling me how to vote. This means I would be able to better represent the views of local people rather than narrow party interests. Please make me your new MP on December 12th.
